intro: Lepechinia schiedeana, commonly known as the Schiedea lepechinia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its small, evergreen shrub form. The plant features dense, dark green foliage and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
